| **Ballarat & District Aboriginal Co‑operative** | Ballarat, Victoria | 106‑108 Armstrong Street North Ballarat VIC 3350; Phone: (03) 5331 5344 citeturn0search5 | Good candidate for rural/regional setting; likely to have issues around capacity / remoteness; ask what supports exist, what gaps. Barriers include discrimination, lack of cultural mentoring, sometimes insufficient supervisor support in addressing cultural issues. They recognise certain communication, relationship, trust, contextual issues are different in Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander consultations

learnings.summary: Methodology: Guides such as “Culturally Safe GP Registrar Supervision – Decolonisation and a Strengths‑Based Appr
learnings.details:
Guides such as “Culturally Safe GP Registrar Supervision – Decolonisation and a Strengths‑Based Approach”; teaching plans; resources for supervisors to build cultural competence. |
| *Racism and cultural safety for Indigenous general practice trainees* (mixed‑methods, 2024) citeturn0search1turn0search15 | GP trainees who are Aboriginal and/or Torres Strait Islander, in metropolitan or rural settings | Many trainees reported experiencing racism in training, and that cultural safety/competence components of training are not always robust or consistent. ---

If you like, I can collect 5‑10 of the most relevant articles in full, summarising methods, sample, setting, findings, and map them by region/cohort, to feed directly into your matrix
learnings.evidence: Guides such as “Culturally Safe GP Registrar Supervision – Decolonisation and a Strengths‑Based Approach”; teaching plans; resources for supervisors to build cultural competence
